name: Character Assistant Core
tagline: Live2D Character + Claude Sonnet 4.5 conversational agent
description: The heart of NEXUS. A Live2D character-driven conversational AI powered by Claude Sonnet 4.5. Provides visual feedback through 4 animation states (Idle, Speaking, Listening, Thinking) while maintaining multi-turn context across sessions. Real-time streaming via SSE keeps the UI synchronized with agent activity.
key_features: Live2D character with 4 animation states (Idle/Speaking/Listening/Thinking)
Multi-provider LLM gateway (Claude Sonnet 4.5, GPT-4, Gemini)
Streaming responses via Server-Sent Events (SSE)
Session-based context management with multi-tenant isolation
Automatic report deduplication and correlation tracking
use_cases: Research assistance with persistent conversation context
Document analysis across multiple Korean HWP/PDF files
Team collaboration with shared sessions and visual status
Complex multi-step tasks with visible agent state transitions

name: Human-in-the-loop Approval System
tagline: Risk-based approval workflow with GREEN/YELLOW/RED gates
description: Built-in approval gates ensure NEXUS never acts recklessly. Every action is assessed for risk: GREEN (auto-execute), YELLOW (notify), RED (require explicit approval). Two-phase commit protocol prevents external sharing or file deletion without user consent. Live2D character shows Alert glow (red) when approval is pending.
key_features: Three-tier risk assessment (GREEN/YELLOW/RED)
Two-phase commit for RED actions (external share, file ops)
202 Accepted pattern with SSE-driven UI updates
Visual feedback via Live2D character (Alert glow)
Approval queue with timeout and retry logic
use_cases: Autonomous document processing with safety checks
External file sharing with mandatory user approval
Team workflows where critical actions need oversight
Research environments with sensitive data protection

name: RAG Engine (Token Overlap)
tagline: Token overlap-based retrieval with native Korean HWP support
description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation engine optimized for Korean academic workflows. Supports HWP (Hangul Word Processor) files natively via external conversion fallback. Token overlap-based ranking (simple but effective). Automatic ingestion scheduled at 03:00 KST daily. Evidence tracking includes doc_id, chunk_id, page, and offset for full traceability.
key_features: Native Korean HWP document support (external conversion)
Token overlap-based retrieval (fast, no embeddings needed)
Automatic daily ingestion (03:00 KST)
Evidence tracking (doc_id, chunk_id, page, offset)
Local-first architecture (no cloud uploads)
use_cases: Academic literature review with Korean papers
Legal document analysis with citation tracking
limitations: HWP requires external conversion (fallback to sibling PDF/TXT)

name: YouTube Integration
tagline: Search, queue, and embedded playback with tenant isolation
description: Full YouTube integration for research and learning workflows. Search via YouTube Data API v3 with 1-hour caching. Queue management with Redis-based persistence (tenant+session isolated). Embedded player support. Live2D character shows Speaking state when describing video content.
key_features: YouTube search with 1-hour cache (API quota optimization)
Queue management (add, remove, clear, sync)
Tenant+session isolated queues (multi-user support)
Embedded player with iframe support
Live2D character describes videos when queued

name: Canvas Workspace
tagline: Local draft storage with multi-format export
description: Collaborative workspace for drafting and editing documents. Local storage in browser (no server uploads). Multi-format export (Markdown, TXT, JSON). Live2D character shows Thinking state during long drafts. Designed for researchers who need quick note-taking with full data control.
key_features: Browser-based local storage (no server sync)
Multi-format export (Markdown, TXT, JSON)
Auto-save every 5 seconds
Collaborative editing ready (future: WebSocket sync)
Live2D character provides writing feedback
use_cases: Research note drafting during literature review

name: Multi-tenant Context
tagline: Org-id and project-id scoping with credential isolation
description: Enterprise-grade multi-tenancy for team deployments. Every request is scoped by org-id and project-id headers. Credential vault isolates API keys per tenant. Cost tagging and audit trails ensure full accountability. Live2D character remains tenant-specific (no cross-tenant state leaks).
key_features: Org-id and project-id based context scoping
Credential vault with per-tenant API key isolation
Cost tagging for LLM usage tracking
Full audit trail with correlation_id propagation
Zero cross-tenant data leakage (Redis namespacing)
use_cases: University research labs with multiple projects

name: Node Management (Windows Pairing)
tagline: Windows node pairing with command queue and report upload
description: Extends NEXUS to Windows desktop environments. Node pairing via 6-digit code (5-minute TTL). Command queue with HTTP long polling (outbound-only, no inbound ports). Supports local folder ingestion and report upload. Live2D character shows Busy glow when node is executing tasks.
key_features: 6-digit enrollment code with 5-minute TTL
HTTP long polling for command delivery (no inbound ports)
Local folder scan and text extraction
Report upload with SSE real-time UI updates
Auto-ingest to RAG engine on task completion
use_cases: Local file indexing from Windows desktop
Intranet document ingestion without cloud upload
Personal knowledge base from local folders

name: Observability Stack
description: Monitoring and observability for production deployments. Prometheus metrics for task creation, LLM calls, callback rates, and queue failures. Correlation_id propagation ensures full request traceability. PII masking in logs (email, phone, API keys). Live2D character state transitions are logged for debugging.
key_features: Prometheus metrics (/metrics endpoint)
Correlation_id propagation across services
PII masking in audit logs (regex-based)
Key metrics: task_create, llm_generate, callback_total
Live2D state transitions logged for debugging
roadmap: Alert rules (high error rate, slow response)
